definition: to give attention to sth/please give (some of your valuable) attention to my task/to be distracted

to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)

sentences.english: Hot cars and pretty girls may go well together, but don't be distracted by them.
sentences.chinese: 香车配美女，但是不要因为她们分神。

sentences.english: Don't let yourself procrastinate and beware of things that would sidetrack you.
sentences.chinese: 不要受干扰，注意那些会让你分神的事物。

sentences.english: She didn’t want him to stray, to find his adventure elsewhere.
sentences.chinese: 她不希望他分神去别处猎艳。

sentences.english: Distracted, he had not realized Anakin was rising until his Padawan was almost to his feet.
sentences.chinese: 欧比万稍一分神，没有注意到阿纳金几乎要站了起来。

sentences.english: It is not just the distractions of open-plan offices that lower  productivity.
sentences.chinese: 开放式办公室造成工作效率下降的原因不只是分神。

sentences.english: Once you have eliminated these distractions, forget about your hands.
sentences.chinese: 一旦你消除掉了这些分神之事，忘掉你的双手。

sentences.english: But he kept getting distracted and losing count.
sentences.chinese: 可是他一直分神而忘了数的数字。

sentences.english: Can you please knock it off! I have lots of homework to do, but you're distracting me.
sentences.chinese: 你能停一停吗？我有很多作业，你让我很分神。

sentences.english: I do not wish to be distracted by another.
Don't distract me. I'm trying to concentrate on my studying.
sentences.chinese: 别让我分神，我要专心学习。

definition: to spare time for a separate task/doppelgänger/sockpuppet (Internet slang)
mind/state of mind/attention/(Chinese medicine) psychic constitution
to do two things at once (idiom)/to multitask/to divide one's attention
Mahayana, the Great Vehicle/Buddhism based on the Mayahana sutras, as spread to Central Asia, China and beyond/also pr. [Da4 cheng2]
